PAS.content: she slips into the water when she is abandoned by ses pas
PAS.linkedContent: she slips into the water when she is abandoned by ses pas

PAS.content: water: a movement w/out pas, beyond all tension (crispation) of pas, degree zero of an infinite metaphor [see p. (84) sans as degree o]
PAS.linkedContent: water: a movement w/out pas, beyond all tension (crispation) of pas, degree zero of an infinite metaphor [see p. (84) sans as degree o]

PAS.content: eau, element where she no longer can find a foothold, also element of “sovereign time,” illusion du sans-pas, of the absence of space, when ses pas have left her, her movement is always entry, penetration [see HYMEN]
PAS.linkedContent: eau, element where she no longer can find a foothold, also element of “sovereign time,” illusion du sans-pas, of the absence of space, when ses pas have left her, her movement is always entry, penetration [see HYMEN]

PAS.content: water as cruel illusion of “sovereign time,” illusion of sans pas
PAS.linkedContent: water as cruel illusion of “sovereign time,” illusion of sans pas

PAS.content: name, thing, element of name or thing, syllable or letter determines eau as sea, tide, with rhythms and edges (bordures), shores or wrecks (rivages ou naufrages)
PAS.linkedContent: name, thing, element of name or thing, syllable or letter determines eau as sea, tide, with rhythms and edges (bordures), shores or wrecks (rivages ou naufrages)

PAS.content: neither word nor syllable eau, o, could signify affection by which what departs from come relates to itself from the other: there was no water
PAS.linkedContent: neither word nor syllable eau, o, could signify affection by which what departs from come relates to itself from the other: there was no water

PAS.content: waters (parages), where every machine is stopped
le surgissement, calling someone to his own proper name in water > analyze baptism from this gift of the name
PAS.linkedContent: le surgissement, calling someone to his own proper name in water > analyze baptism from this gift of the name

PAS.content: Blanchot: looking at them (elles) as if they had risen from their graves, and, I remain in their fascination > c’est la scène d’eau, la noyade et l’éventualité de viens
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: looking at them (elles) as if they had risen from their graves, and, I remain in their fascination > c’est la scène d’eau, la noyade et l’éventualité de viens

PAS.content: eau is a rebus, a morsel (morceau) or moment of a word (thing, letter, names, syllable, cry) > like sans, pas, sauf, rat, not a theme, sense, signifier
PAS.linkedContent: eau is a rebus, a morsel (morceau) or moment of a word (thing, letter, names, syllable, cry) > like sans, pas, sauf, rat, not a theme, sense, signifier

PAS.content: the immense always brings us back to the water
PAS.linkedContent: the immense always brings us back to the water

PAS.content: in a moment of extreme, precipitous virtuosity, where o (mort, fors, faux, faut, zéro, mot) resonates everywhere and nom turns to mon, Derrida asks himself if his policing overzealousness [to unmask the absence of the name, le pas-de-nom] deciphers identities [maur/chot, m’: o], wants to catch everything in a dragnet (filet)
PAS.linkedContent: in a moment of extreme, precipitous virtuosity, where o (mort, fors, faux, faut, zéro, mot) resonates everywhere and nom turns to mon, Derrida asks himself if his policing overzealousness [to unmask the absence of the name, le pas-de-nom] deciphers identities [maur/chot, m’: o], wants to catch everything in a dragnet (filet)

PAS.content: o as degree 0 (of appearance), double 0 as “power of 0 and 2” > the pas de Sans-Nom, EROS, neither gathers, identifies, nor excludes the one or the other
PAS.linkedContent: o as degree 0 (of appearance), double 0 as “power of 0 and 2” > the pas de Sans-Nom, EROS, neither gathers, identifies, nor excludes the one or the other

PAS.content: name is no more its infinitely divisible elements than it is dispersed in them like foam in anonymous sea [Kant’s simple/composite]
PAS.linkedContent: name is no more its infinitely divisible elements than it is dispersed in them like foam in anonymous sea [Kant’s simple/composite]

PPHS.content: Hegel [Science of Logic]: sign, more precisely Sprache, fulfills spiritual function of middle (like water in nature)
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel [Science of Logic]: sign, more precisely Sprache, fulfills spiritual function of middle (like water in nature)

PPHS.content: Vorstellung, remembered-interiorized intuition; Erinnerung, interiorized memory, places images in reserve, like water in unconscious pit, like vein at bottom of mine > permits passage to conceptuality
PPHS.linkedContent: Vorstellung, remembered-interiorized intuition; Erinnerung, interiorized memory, places images in reserve, like water in unconscious pit, like vein at bottom of mine > permits passage to conceptuality

RM.content: [cf. Pas] the dérive or dérapage (skidding) as un certain jeu de l’ancre in surrounding waters (parages): Derrida can only stop engines (machines) of this floating vehicle [my discourse on metaphor], which would still abandon it to its unforeseeable dérive [more metaphorico]
RM.linkedContent: [cf. Pas] the dérive or dérapage (skidding) as un certain jeu de l’ancre in surrounding waters (parages): Derrida can only stop engines (machines) of this floating vehicle [my discourse on metaphor], which would still abandon it to its unforeseeable dérive [more metaphorico]

BSi.content: [re: D.H. Lawerence’s poem “Snake”] scene of hospitality at water source
BSi.linkedContent: [re: D.H. Lawerence’s poem “Snake”] scene of hospitality at water source

OG.content: Rousseau: cradle of nations, first fires of love born at water wells; p. 267 “well of oath” in Genesis XXI
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: cradle of nations, first fires of love born at water wells; p. 267 “well of oath” in Genesis XXI

OG.content: neume, epoch of natural languages: fête autour du point d’eau, temps de l’Isle de Saint-Pierre [?]: l’image fixant ce qui ne fut qu’un point de pur passage—la limite toujours déjà franchie, rèpere absolu
OG.linkedContent: neume, epoch of natural languages: fête autour du point d’eau, temps de l’Isle de Saint-Pierre [?]: l’image fixant ce qui ne fut qu’un point de pur passage—la limite toujours déjà franchie, rèpere absolu
